title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Restriction of
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Restriction of 
Certain Hazardous Substances in Electrical and Electronic Equipment) 
(Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2020. 

Purpose of Regulations
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (restriction certain hazardous substance electrical electronic equipment) (amendment) (no 2) regulation 2020 purpose regulation

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 2. The purpose for which these Regulations are made is to give effect to
text_raw:
2. The purpose for which these Regulations are made is to give effect to 
the provisions of Commission Delegated Directive (EU) 2020/364 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 17 December 2019 amending, for 
the purposes of adapting to scientific and technical progress Annex IV to 
Directive 2011/65/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 8 June 
2011 on the restriction of the use of certain hazardous substances in electrical 
and electronic equipment. 

Amendment of Definition
text_norm: 2 purpose regulation made give effect provision commission delegated directive (eu) 2020 364 european parliament council 17 december 2019 amending purpose adapting scientific technical progress annex iv directive 2011 65 eu european parliament council 8 june 2011 restriction use certain hazardous substance electrical electronic equipment amendment definition

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 3. Regulation 3(1) of the European Union (Restriction of Certain
text_raw:
3. Regulation 3(1) of the European Union (Restriction of Certain 
Hazardous Substances in Electrical and Electronic Equipment) Regulations 
2012 (S.I. No. 513 of 2012) is amended by substituting for the definition of 
“the Directive” the following: 

“ “the Directive” means European Parliament and Council Directive 
2011/65/EU on the restriction of the use of certain hazardous 
substances in electrical and electronic equipment, as amended by 
Commission Delegated Directives 2012/50/EU and 2012/51/EU of 10 
October 2012 and Commission Delegated Directives 2014/1/EU, 
2014/6/EU, 
2014/4/EU, 
2014/2/EU, 
2014/7/EU, 2014/8/EU, 2014/9/EU, 2014/10/EU, 2014/11/EU, 
2014/12/EU, 2014/13/EU, 2014/14/EU, 2014/15/EU and 2014/16/EU 

2014/5/EU, 

2014/3/EU, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 31st July, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [264] 3 

of 18 October 2013 and Commission Delegated Directives 
2014/69/EU, 2014/70/EU, 2014/71/EU, 2014/72/EU, 2014/73/EU, 
2014/74/EU, 2014/75/EU and 2014/76/EU of 13 March 2014 and 
Commission Delegated Directives (EU) 2015/573 and (EU) 2015/574 
of the European Parliament and of the Council of 30 January 2015 and 
Commission Delegated Directive (EU) 2015/863 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 31 March 2015 and Commission 
Delegated Directive (EU) 2016/585 of the European Parliament and of 
the Council of 12 February 2016 and Commission Delegated 
Directives (EU) 2016/1028 and (EU) 2016/1029 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 19 April 2016 and Commission 
Delegated Directives (EU) 2017/1975 of the European Parliament and 
of the Council of 7 August 2017 and (EU) 2017/1011 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 15 March 2017 and Commission 
Delegated Directives (EU) 2017/1010 and (EU) 2017/1009 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 13 March 2017 and 
Directive (EU) 2017/2102 of the European Parliament and of the 
Council of 15 November 2017 and Commission Delegated Directives 
(EU) 2018/736, (EU) 2018/737 and (EU) 2018/738 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 27 February 2018 and Commission 
Delegated Directives (EU) 2018/739, (EU) 2018/740, (EU) 2018/741 
and (EU) 2018/742 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 
1 March 2018 and Commission Delegated Directive (EU) 2019/178 of 
the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 November 2018 and 
Commission Delegated Directives (EU) 2019/169, (EU) 2019/170, 
(EU) 2019/171, (EU) 2019/172, (EU) 2019/173, (EU) 2019/174, (EU) 
2019/175, (EU) 2019/176, (EU) 2019/177 of the European Parliament 
and of the Council of 16 November 2018 and Commission Delegated 
Directives (EU) 2019/1845 and (EU) 2019/1846 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 8 August 2019 and Commission 
Delegated Directive (EU) 2020/364 of the European Parliament and of 
the Council of 17 December 2019;”. 

Commencement

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 4. These Regulations shall come into effect on 1 September 2020.
text_raw:
4. These Regulations shall come into effect on 1 September 2020. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 July, 2020. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Communications, Climate Action 
and Environment. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [264]
text_norm: 4 regulation shall come effect 1 september 2020 given official seal 28 july 2020 eamon ryan minister communication climate action environment 4 264

title: European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the European Union (Restriction of Certain 
Hazardous Substances in Electrical and Electronic Equipment) Regulations 
2012 (S.I. No. 513 of 2012) in order to give effect to the provisions of the 
following Commission Delegated Directive: 

a) 

Commission Delegated Directive 
(EU) 2020/364 of 17 
December 2019 amending, for the purposes of adapting to 
scientific and technical progress, Annex IV to Directive 
2011/65/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council as 
regards an exemption for the use of cadmium in certain radiation 
tolerant video camera tubes. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [264] 5
